{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-047-20-B
|Item_parent=Follow-up of normal infants, children and adolescents. Screening for orthopaedic, visual, hearing and dental abnormalities. Compulsory health examinations. School medicine. Child mortality and morbidity
|Item_parent_short=Follow-up of normal infants, children and adolescents. Screening for orthopaedic, visual, hearing and dental abnormalities. Compulsory health examinations. School medicine. Child mortality and morbidity
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing how to identify a dental articulation disorder
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=
|Order=20}}
Dental articulation = relationship between the maxillary and mandibular teeth

Joint disorder = conflict between the 2 dental arches

Manifested by: an open bite, lateral deviation of the mandible, prognathia, abutting incisors, overlapping, maxillary proaleviation

Orthodontic treatment before the age of 16

question.title: What is a dental articulation disorder?
question.description: A dental articulation disorder is a relationship between the maxillary and mandibular teeth that is abnormal.

option_a.title: A joint disorder between the two dental arches
option_a.description: A joint disorder is a conflict between the two dental arches.

option_b.title: A relationship between the maxillary and mandibular teeth that is normal
option_b.description: A normal dental articulation is a relationship between the maxillary and mandibular teeth that is typical.

option_c.title: A condition where the maxillary teeth are too far forward
option_c.description: Maxillary proaleviation is a condition where the maxillary teeth are too far forward.

option_d.title: A dental articulation disorder that is manifested by an open bite
option_d.description: An open bite is a dental articulation disorder that is characterized by an opening between the upper and lower teeth.
